Search: id:a006697

%I A006697 M1001
%S A006697 1,2,4,6,9,13,17,22,28,35,43,51,60,70,81,93,106,120,135,151,167,184,
%T A006697 202,221,241,262,284,307,331,356,382,409,437,466,496,527,559,591,624,
%U A006697 658,693,729,766,804,843,883,924,966,1009,1053,1098,1144,1191,1239
%N A006697 Number of subwords of length n in infinite word generated by a -> aab, b -> b.
%D A006697 J.-P. Allouche and J. Shallit, The ring of k-regular sequences, Theoretical Computer Sci., 98 (1992), 163-197.
%D A006697 N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
%H A006697 Vincenzo Librandi, <a href="/A006697/b006697.txt">Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000</a>
%F A006697 G.f.: 1 + 1/(1-x) + 1/(1-x)^2 * [1/(1-x) - sum(k>=1, x^(2^k+k-1))] (conjectured). - _Ralf Stephan_, Mar 05 2004
%F A006697 Conjectures: partial sums of A103354, also equal to A094913(n) + 1. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 19 2005
%F A006697 a(n) = sum(k=0,n,min(2^k,n-k+1)) = 2^(m+1)-1 + (n-m)(n-m+1)/2 with m = [ n+1-LambertW( 2^(n+1) * log(2) ) / log(2) ] = integer part of the solution to 2^m = n+1-m. (conjectured). - _M. F. Hasler_, Dec 14 2007
%t A006697 A103354[n_] := Floor[ FullSimplify[ ProductLog[ 2^n*Log[2]]/Log[2]]]; Accumulate[ Table[ A103354[n], {n, 1, 54}]] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 13 2011, after M. F. Hasler *)
%o A006697 (PARI) LambertW(y) = solve( X=1,log(y), X*exp(X)-y) A006697(n,b=2)=local(m=floor(n+1-LambertW(b^(n+1)*log(b))/log(b)));(b^(m+1)-1)/(b-1)+(n-m)*(n-m+1)/2 - _M. F. Hasler_, Dec 14 2007
%Y A006697 Cf. A005943, A005942, A094913, A134457, A134466.
%K A006697 nonn,easy,nice
%O A006697 0,2
%A A006697 _N. J. A. Sloane_, _Jeffrey Shallit_
%E A006697 More terms from Michel ten Voorde (seqfan(AT)tenvoorde.org) Apr 11 2001
